column4: I need help upgrading 10.04 to 10.10. Every time I try using the Update Manager I always get this error: http://pastebin.com/aPHBR1hT. I'm on a fresh install with no unusual packages installed, so what gives?
how long has this been happening?
I just freshly installed today, but it has been happening ever since I originally installed 10.04
hmm, Im not sure which is the relevant log file.  Maybe you could run do-release-upgrade to get a better error msg?
that gives me the exact same error, and it rolls back the upgrade either way
well, Im looking for a more detailed error
this is the complete error I get when I try upgrading from either terminal or the gui: http://pastebin.com/gqAvnwTd
you should check some of the files in /var/log/dist-upgrade
maybe you could pastebin main.log?
this is the complete main.log http://pastebin.com/rFvATchp
well that isn't it, maybe term.log
the term.log is empty
apt.log?
http://pastebin.com/AqYKCdW6
have you ever installed updated xorg packages?
the only thing I have done on this system since a fresh install is doing an update of what Ubuntu says should be updated, so no I don't believe so
did you post history.log yet?
would that be in the same directory? no such file exists
I dunno then, that's all the files right?
yes... so should I just download a 10.10 ISO and install that?
sure, if that works for you
not the ideal situation I was hoping for, but it'll work. thank you for trying.
